intro: Adicea franquevilleana, commonly known as the Franqueville's adicea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that often have four petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
